context.text: He therefore brought suit in federal court challenging the constitutionality of the federal statute and the District Judge held the statute unconstitutional and entered an injunction requiring that his name be allowed to appear on the ballot.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: The election was held without the injunction having been stayed and after the election, the Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit reviewed the District Court decision and reversed and upheld the constitutionality of the statute principally on the ground that performed the function of allowing the voters adequate time to become informed about the qualifications of candidates.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens

context.text: Griffin was a case involving a conspiracy aimed at black Americans attempting to assert their civil rights and those who would assist them.

context.text: The court analyzed the matter as resting on the Thirteenth Amendment base and the right and power of Congress to do away with the badges and incidence of slavery.

context.speaker: Laurence Stephen Gold
context.text: It is perfectly well settled that Congress in no way, shape, or form is limited by a state action requirement in those regards and that those constitutional rights, both the rights vouchsafed by the Thirteenth Amendment and the rights stated by the right of travel are protected against private interferences.

context.speaker: Laurence Stephen Gold

context.text: The Government brought this action to enjoin Generix from distributing in interstate commerce various generic drug products that contain the same active ingredients as approved drugs but not necessarily the same inactive ingredients.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: The District Court found that the differences in the generic drugs from the approved products might promote a health -- might cause a health hazard and therefore, enjoined distribution of the drugs, and the Court of Appeals however, construed the term, "drug" to refer only to the active ingredient and therefore, reversed the District Court's injunction.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: The question we had to decide is whether the word, "drug" in the statute includes merely the active ingredient or the entire product and we hold that the term does include the entire product and therefore, we reverse the judgment of the Court of Appeals.

context.text: The dismissal of the indictment was purely a technical matter, and it would certainly--

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: Are you aware of any cases in which a conviction had been reinstated without the indictment... I mean, a conviction had been reinstated without an indictment being in the case, in the record?

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --Justice Stevens, I must confess, I don't know what happens as a technical matter to the indictment when the conviction is reinstated, but I think that when--

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: I have never heard of it.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: I have thought about this quite a bit, and I can't think of an analogy.

context.speaker: William J. Brennan, Jr.
context.text: Why not a stay of the mandate?

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --I won't dispute the fact that that's probably the preferable alternative, but I don't think that--

context.speaker: William J. Brennan, Jr.
context.text: Well, why was it... why was dismissal sought?

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --As a fact, I don't know, Justice Brennan.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: I think it was done to comply with the Court of Appeals mandate, at a time before the final decision to seek review in this Court was made.

context.speaker: Warren E. Burger
context.text: Did the Court of Appeals mandate address itself to the indictment or merely set aside the judgments?

context.speaker: Harry A. Blackmun
context.text: Certainly there is nothing in the judgment of the Court of Appeals that in so many words said that the indictment should be dismissed.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --That is certainly correct, but when... in a case of this sort, when the convictions are founded upon the discovery of contraband, the suppression of that contraband necessarily means that there will no longer have been--

context.text: Was there some transcript made at that time of what happened in court?

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --I assume there was, Justice White.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: I have not reviewed it.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: And looking here at the docket sheets, it is not clear which party moved for dismissal of the indictment.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: Or stayed.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --or stayed, then compliance with the Court of Appeals mandate as a practical matter would have necessitated dismissal of the indictment.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: No, it would have necessitated a motion for a stay.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: Well, that's right, Justice Stevens, but our position is that making such a stay motion is not necessary to preserve a live controversy.

context.speaker: John Paul Stevens
context.text: Well, but you don't have any authority for that proposition.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: Well, we don't have authority for that proposition because it was not Respondent's contention at any point that dismissal of the indictment was what mooted this case.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: Well, we don't have authority for that proposition because it was not Respondent's contention at any point that dismissal of the indictment was what mooted this case.

context.speaker: Warren E. Burger
context.text: It wouldn't necessarily follow that there would be a new trial, if the only evidence the government had was the evidence that was suppressed.

context.text: The government routinely dismisses indictments, or just doesn't pursue an outstanding indictment.

context.text: Well, they don't dismiss the indictment.

context.speaker: Thurgood Marshall
context.text: They just don't prosecute it.

context.speaker: Samuel A. Alito, Jr.
context.text: --Well, I believe at a certain point there is a motion to dismiss the indictment.
